questionTitle: If you have a local version of a file, then a version of that file stored in the cloud conforms to all three of the ______ backup rules.
questionExplanation: Peter Krogh’s 3-2-1 Rule for data protection is a good one to follow.

questionOption1: Replication creates a copy of the data which is not synchronized
questionOption2: An archive removes older information that is no longer operational and saves it for long-term storage
questionOption3: Reverse delta backup allows a system to do what is referred to as a bare metal restore
questionExplanation: A backup creates a copy of the data whereas an archive removes older information.

questionTitle: Which of the following is the first rule according to 3-2-1 Backup Rule by Peter Krogh?
questionOption1: Retain three copies of any file—an original and two backups
questionOption2: Files must be on two different media types
questionOption3: One copy must be stored offsite
questionExplanation: Files must be on two different media types such as hard drives and optical media to protect against different types of hazards.

questionTitle: Which of the following is an incorrect feature of cloud storage backup solution?
questionExplanation: High Encryption is provided by Cloud Backup Storage.

questionOption1: In a differential backup, the backup software can obtain the up-to-date backup from the last full backup and the last incremental backup alone
questionOption2: Incremental backup analyzes the transactions that are in progress
questionOption3: A cloud storage system contains a certain built-in latency, so unless the original data set is quiescent, the mirror lags behind the original in concurrency
questionExplanation: An open file backup analyzes the transactions that are in progress.

questionTitle: How many bits of encryption is at least required for cloud backup storage solution?
questionExplanation: High encryption of data transfers is carried out preferably end-to-end, but at least for the data that is transferred over the Internet.

questionTitle: Which of the following is the most important client to back up in the cloud?
